intro: Sida multifida, commonly known as the palmate sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmately lobed leaves, which are often hairy and have a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Sida multifida is typically found in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and riverbanks.
